articles.title: Moves for Expansion of U.S. Military Base Assailed in S. Korea
U.S. Stepped-Up Nuclear Arms Build-Up under Fire
articles.content:
Moves for Expansion of U.S. Military Base Assailed in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- The 562nd candlelight rally reportedly took place in Phaengsong, Kyonggi Province, south Korea on Mar. 16 in protest against the moves of the south Korean "Ministry of National Defense" for requisitioning land for the expansion of the U.S. military base in Phyongthaek.
 The rally was attended by inhabitants of Phaengsong preparing for the ploughing of rice fields as resistance against the measure taken by the ministry to forcibly evacuate residents from the land designated as sites for the U.S. military base in Phyongthaek and the farmers and members of different organizations who went there from South and North Chungchong Provinces, Kyonggi Province, South and North Jolla Provinces, south Korean Kangwon Province and other parts of south Korea to express solidarity with the peasants, at least 300 in all.    
 Speakers at the rally vehemently denounced the ministry for working hard to offer the land of Phyongthaek to the U.S. forces, utterly indifferent to the people's fate, and strongly demanded it cancel this plan at once.

articles.title: U.S. Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Racket Blasted
articles.content:
U.S. Stepped-Up Nuclear Arms Build-Up under Fire 
    Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- The United States is a nuclear criminal as it does not hesitate to bring a nuclear holocaust to humankind and a nuclear rogue bereft of reason, preoccupied by nuclear hysteria, says Minju Joson Tuesday in a signed commentary accusing the U.S. of its dangerous moves to maintain an unchallenged edge in the field of the nuclear armed forces and realize its ambition to dominate the world. 
 Drawing attention to the U.S. moves to round off the preparations for a preemptive nuclear attack on the DPRK through the modernization of nuclear weapons, the news analyst goes on:    
 The U.S. developed new-type nuclear missiles capable of penetrating underground aimed to destroy underground military facilities in the DPRK and has already decided to deploy them in south Korea on a priority basis. Now it is busy with its moves to develop and deploy the missile defence system (MD) as a prerequisite to realizing its attempt at a preemptive nuclear attack.    
 It decided to deploy 20 interceptor missiles in Alaska and two more of them in California by 2007 under the pretext of countering "missile attack" from the DPRK.
 This cannot be interpreted otherwise than a serious development as the true objective of its moves to bolster MD is to neutralize the defence capability of the DPRK and mount a preemptive nuclear attack on it without much difficulty.
 The DPRK will increase its war deterrent in every way to foil the U.S. hostile policy toward it and Washington's escalated moves to provoke a new war.

articles.title: Increased Driving Force for Korean Reunification Called for
articles.content:
U.S. Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Racket Blasted 
    Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Some time ago, high-ranking officials of the U.S. administration including Bush and Rice vied with each other to raise a hue and cry over the "human rights situation" in the DPRK as part of its smear campaign against it.
 This is nothing but a ridiculous "human rights" racket kicked off by the worst human rights abuser, a base mudslinging and a sinister political provocation against the DPRK. Rodong Sinmun Tuesday observes this in a signed commentary. It goes on:
 The U.S. has neither right nor face to talk about human rights.
 It is a typical inhuman society where people are denied elementary right to existence and human rights are wantonly violated.    
 The U.S. has blatantly abused human rights not only in the international arena but at home. The U.S. imperialists invaded and occupied Iraq in a brigandish manner defying the UN and the world public protest, cruelly killing innocent Iraqis. They made no scruple of using even chemical weapons in Iraq to burn many civilians including children and women to death in gross violation of international law and conventions.
 This being a hard reality, the U.S. claims to be a "defender of human rights" and a "human rights judge", shamelessly paying lip-service to human rights. This is an insult to the genuine human rights and human conscience.    
 The U.S. loudmouthed "human rights issue" is nothing but a political fiction aimed at intensifying its interference in the internal affairs of other countries and its operations to overthrow their governments and stifle them. The "human rights" racket launched by the U.S. against the DPRK on the basis of the above-said fiction would get it nowhere. 
 The U.S. would be well advised to immediately halt the politically-motivated "human rights" racket against the DPRK.

articles.title: Greetings to Iranian President
Greetings to Iranian VIPs
articles.content:
Greetings to Iranian President 
    Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad on the occasion of the New Year in Iran.
 Kim Yong Nam in the message expressed conviction that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would develop on good terms, in the future, too and wholeheartedly wished him good health and happiness and great success in his responsible work to build independent and prosperous Islamic society.

articles.title: Technical Innovation Contests of A-class Football Teams
articles.content:
Greetings to Iranian VIPs 
    Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Pak Pong Ju and Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun separately sent messages of greetings to First Vice-President of Iran Parviz Davudi and Foreign Minister Manuchehr Mottaki on the occasion of the New Year in Iran.
 Pak Pong Ju expressed conviction that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger and develop in different fields and wholeheartedly wished the vice-president good health and the friendly Iranian government and people prosperity and progress.

articles.title: DPRK Consolidates Self-defensive War Deterrent
articles.content:
Technical Innovation Contests of A-class Football Teams 
    Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- The year's first technical innovation contests (March 10-30) of A-class football teams of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea are going on at Kim Il Sung Stadium in Pyongyang.
 Participating in the league matches are men and women's soccer teams from the April 25, Amnokgang, Rimyongsu, Pyongyang City, Wolmido and other sports groups.
 As of March 20, men footballers of the Amnokgang and Kigwancha Sports Groups and women footballers of the April 25 Sports Group gave a good account of themselves.
 The technical innovation contests, annual events in the DPRK, are contributing to training soccer players physically and technically and developing the football techniques of the country.    
 The second and third contests will take place in May and June this year.

articles.title: Face-lifting of Pyongyang
articles.content:
Ryonghyon Revolutionary Site
    Pyongyang, March 21 (KCNA) -- The Ryonghyon Revolutionary Site in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea is a significant place associated with revolutionary activities of Kim Hyong Jik, an indomitable revolutionary fighter and an outstanding leader of the anti-Japanese national liberation movement.
 He visited Ryonghyon-ri of Suan County, North Hwanghae Province, several times from Juche 1 (1912) to Juche 6 (1917) and awakened broad masses with his energetic mass enlightenment activities and aroused them to the anti-Japanese struggle.
 In March 1912, during his attendance at Pyongyang Sungsil Middle School, he visited the place to educate students of Training Course for Surveyors in anti-Japanese patriotic idea and give a lecture among students of Mongun School, calling upon them to rise up in the struggle against the Japanese imperialists who invaded Korea, true to the fighting spirit of famous patriotic generals. In August he organized a drama performance of the art troupe of Pyongyang Sungsil Middle School and made a speech calling upon the masses to turn out as one in the sagacious struggle against the Japanese imperialists.    
 Later, he guided the reading sessions of Mongun School and the meetings of participants in the movement for independence in the area, teaching them how to gain comrades who would be pillars in the independence movement.
 He formed a Sugok branch of the Korean National Association there in June 1917 which would guide the anti-Japanese movement in Suan and Koksan in a unified way. The Sugok branch played a great role in expanding the anti-Japanese national liberation movement on a nation-wide scale.    
 The revolutionary site was rebuilt as it was on the occasion of his 100th birthday (July, 1994). It includes a lodging house where he enlightened participants in the volunteers' army, public-spirited men and youth and students of the village, Training Course for Surveyors, Mongun School, an oratorical meeting site on Pari Hill, etc.
 A large number of working people and youth and students are now visiting the revolutionary site to keep in mind the immortal exploits of Kim Hyong Jik, who devoted his all to the liberation of the country with his lofty idea of "Aim High".
